dashboard.recalculate: Finds new matches by comparing your cards for sale/trade with other users' wishlists, and vice versa.
dashboard.sync: Updates your public cards in the system so other users can find you in their searches.
dashboard.deleteData: Permanently deletes all your cards, decks, preferences and matches. This action cannot be undone.
dashboard.searchOthers: Search for cards that other users have available for sale or trade. If you find it, you can express your interest.
dashboard.matchesFound: Number of users who have cards you're looking for, or are looking for cards you have.
dashboard.blockedUsers: Users you've dismissed won't appear in future matches. Unblock them here to see matches from them again.

collection.statusCollection: Personal cards that are not available for sale or trade. Only you can see them.
collection.statusSale: Cards you want to sell. They appear on your public profile and other users can contact you.
collection.statusTrade: Cards available for trade. The system will automatically find matches.
collection.statusWishlist: Cards you're looking for. The system will find users who have them available.
collection.publicCard: This card is visible on your public profile. Other users can see it and contact you.
collection.privateCard: This card is private. Only you can see it in your collection.
collection.deckPublic: All cards in the deck will be visible on your public profile.
collection.deckPrivate: Deck cards will be private and won't appear on your profile.
collection.importDeck: Import a deck from Moxfield or by pasting a card list. They will be added to your collection automatically.

matches.compatibility: Percentage indicating how well your needs match with the other user. Higher % = better match.
matches.bidirectional: Bidirectional match: both have something the other is looking for. Ideal for direct trades.
matches.unidirectional: Unidirectional match: only one has what the other is looking for. May require payment or negotiation.
matches.tabNew: Newly calculated matches you haven't reviewed yet.
matches.tabSent: Matches where you expressed interest. Waiting for the other user's response.
matches.tabSaved: Matches you saved to contact later.
matches.tabDeleted: Deleted matches. They are permanently removed after 15 days.

conditions.M: Mint - Perfect, as if just opened from the booster. No visible defects.
conditions.NM: Near Mint - Almost perfect, may have minimal barely noticeable edge wear.
conditions.LP: Light Play - Lightly played. Small marks or minor visible wear.
conditions.MP: Moderate Play - Visible moderate wear. Marks, small bends or discoloration.
conditions.HP: Heavy Play - Very played. Obvious damage but the card is still tournament legal.
conditions.PO: Poor - Significant poor condition. Only for casual collection or proxies.

cards.foil: Card with holographic/shiny finish. Generally more valuable than the regular version.
cards.price: Reference price in USD according to TCGPlayer. May vary by seller and condition.
cards.edition: Magic set/edition where this card was printed. Affects price and format legality.

decks.mainboard: The main 60 cards of the deck (99 in Commander).
decks.sideboard: 15 optional cards to swap between games in tournaments.
decks.commander: The commander is the leader card of your Commander/EDH deck.
decks.completion: Percentage of deck cards you already have in your collection.

settings.emailVerification: Verifying your email allows other users to contact you and gives you access to all platform features.
settings.password: Your password must be at least 8 characters. Use a combination of letters, numbers and symbols for better security.
settings.username: Your unique username on the platform. It's displayed on your public profile and when other users search for you. You can only change it occasionally.
settings.location: Your location helps find nearby traders for in-person exchanges. You can detect it automatically or enter it manually.
settings.avatar: Your profile picture. By default it's auto-generated based on your username, but you can use a custom image URL.

search.sets: Filter by Magic edition/set. You can select multiple editions. Sets are sorted by release date.
search.manaValue: Converted mana cost. Select one or more values. 10+ includes cards with mana 10 or higher.
search.onlyReleased: Excludes cards from sets that haven't been released yet (previews/spoilers).
search.types: Card type: Creature, Instant, Sorcery, Enchantment, Artifact, Planeswalker or Land.
search.priceUSD: Price range in dollars according to TCGPlayer. Useful for finding cards within your budget.
search.power: Creature power. Numeric values (0-15+). Some cards have variable (*) or undefined power.
search.toughness: Creature toughness. Numeric values (0-15+). Some cards have variable toughness.
search.format: Filter cards legal in specific formats: Standard, Modern, Pioneer, Legacy, Vintage or Commander.
search.combat: Abilities that affect combat: Flying, Trample, First Strike, Deathtouch, Lifelink, etc.
search.effects: Common effects: Destroy, Exile, Draw cards, Create tokens, +1/+1 counters, etc.
search.triggers: Abilities that trigger on events: ETB (enters), LTB (leaves), Attack, Death, etc.
search.setMechanics: Set-specific mechanics: Cascade, Convoke, Delve, Flashback, Madness, etc.
search.specialTypes: Special card types: Legendary, Saga, Equipment, Aura, Vehicle, etc.
search.foilFullArt: Filter by Foil cards (holographic) or Full Art (extended art without border).

step1.title: 1. Add your cards
step1.description: Search for cards and add them to your collection. Mark as 'Sale' or 'Trade' the ones you want to exchange.

step2.title: 2. Create your wishlist
step2.description: Add cards you're looking for with 'Wanted' status. The system will search for users who have them.

step3.title: 3. Find matches
step3.description: Go to Dashboard and calculate matches. The system will automatically find compatible users.

step4.title: 4. Contact and negotiate
step4.description: Use the internal chat to arrange the trade. Cranial only connects, you decide how to make the trade.

tradeSafety.title: Safe Trading
tips: Verify the user's profile and reputation before agreeing to a trade
Use payment methods with buyer protection when possible
Start with small trades to build trust
For shipping, use services with tracking

questions.q: What is a match?
questions.a: A match occurs when there's compatibility between your cards and another user's. Example: You have a 'Lightning Bolt' for sale and Juan has 'Lightning Bolt' in his wishlist ‚Üí Match! The system calculates them automatically by comparing your collection with all users.

questions.q: What types of matches exist?
questions.a: There are two main types: BIDIRECTIONAL and UNIDIRECTIONAL. Bidirectional is when both users have something the other is looking for (ideal for trades). Unidirectional is when only one has what the other needs (usually requires payment).

questions.q: What is a BIDIRECTIONAL match?
questions.a: It's the perfect match for trades. Example: You have 'Counterspell' for sale and want 'Sol Ring'. Maria has 'Sol Ring' for sale and wants 'Counterspell'. Both have what the other needs! They can trade directly without money.

questions.q: What is a UNIDIRECTIONAL match?
questions.a: Occurs when only one party has what the other is looking for. Example: You have 'Black Lotus' for sale, Pedro wants it, but Pedro doesn't have anything you need. Pedro would have to buy it with money instead of trading cards.

questions.q: What's the difference between card statuses?
questions.a: COLLECTION: Personal cards, not available for trade (private). SALE: Cards you sell for money (public). TRADE: Cards for exchange (public). WISHLIST: Cards you want to get. Example: Your 'Mox Diamond' in COLLECTION won't appear in matches, but if you change it to SALE, other users can find it.

questions.q: How does the compatibility percentage work?
questions.a: It measures how balanced the trade is based on total card value. Example: If you offer cards worth $50 and receive cards worth $48, compatibility will be high (~96%). If you offer $100 and receive $30, it will be low (~30%). 100% means exactly equal values.

questions.q: What do the Matches tabs mean?
questions.a: NEW: Newly calculated unreviewed matches. SENT: Matches where you expressed interest, waiting for response. SAVED: Matches you saved to contact later. DELETED: Discarded matches (deleted in 15 days). Example: See an interesting match ‚Üí save it ‚Üí contact the user ‚Üí complete the trade ‚Üí mark as completed.

questions.q: What does it mean for a card to be 'Public'?
questions.a: Public cards appear on your profile (/@yourusername) and other users can find them searching. Private ones only you can see. Example: Your 'Force of Will' for SALE is public and will appear when someone searches for that card. Your 'Island' in COLLECTION is private.

questions.q: How are matches calculated?
questions.a: The system compares: 1) Your cards for SALE/TRADE with other users' WISHLISTS, 2) Your WISHLIST with other users' cards for SALE/TRADE. Example: You have 3 cards for sale and 5 in wishlist. The system compares them with 1000 users' collections and finds 12 potential matches.

questions.q: Can I import my collection from another site?
questions.a: Yes. You can: 1) Import from Moxfield by pasting the deck URL, 2) Paste lists in MTGO/Arena format (e.g., '4 Lightning Bolt' or '4x Lightning Bolt [M10]'), 3) Upload a CSV file (ManaBox compatible format). The system recognizes quantity, name and optionally the set.

questions.q: What do card conditions (M, NM, LP...) mean?
questions.a: M (Mint): Perfect, unused. NM (Near Mint): Almost perfect, minimal wear. LP (Light Play): Small visible marks. MP (Moderate Play): Moderate wear, minor bends. HP (Heavy Play): Obvious damage but playable. PO (Poor): Significant poor condition. Example: A freshly opened card is M/NM, one played in tournaments without sleeves is probably LP/MP.

questions.q: How often are prices updated?
questions.a: Prices are fetched from Scryfall/TCGPlayer when adding or editing a card. To update prices in bulk, use the 'Sync' button on the Dashboard. Prices may vary ¬±10% from actual market depending on edition and condition.

questions.q: Does Cranial Trading charge a commission?
questions.a: No. The platform is 100% free. We only connect users interested in trading cards. Negotiations, payment methods and shipping are agreed directly between you.

questions.q: How do I contact another user?
questions.a: From a match you can: 1) Send internal message through the app chat, 2) See their email (if you completed the match), 3) Visit their public profile. Example: Find a good match ‚Üí click 'Message' ‚Üí arrange the trade via chat ‚Üí exchange shipping details.

questions.q: What if I get scammed?
questions.a: Cranial doesn't intermediate in physical transactions or payments. Recommendations: 1) Verify user profile and seniority, 2) Use PayPal Goods & Services or another protected method, 3) Start with small trades (<$20), 4) Ask for card photos/videos, 5) Use tracked shipping. Report suspicious users.

questions.q: Can I do international trades?
questions.a: Yes, but consider: 1) International shipping costs ($15-30 USD typically), 2) Delivery times (2-4 weeks), 3) Possible customs taxes, 4) Risk of loss in transit. Recommendation: For international trades, make sure the value justifies shipping costs.

questions.q: Can I export my collection or deck?
questions.a: Yes. From the deck panel you can: 1) Copy the list to clipboard in MTGO/Arena format, 2) Download a CSV file compatible with ManaBox and other apps. This allows you to easily move your data between platforms.

questions.q: Can I make my decks public or private?
questions.a: Yes. Each deck has a visibility button (eye icon) in its panel. Public decks appear on your profile and other users can see them. Private decks are only visible to you. Decks are private by default.

questions.q: How does the messaging chat work?
questions.a: When you find an interesting match, you can send a message to the other user directly from the app. Conversations are saved and you can access them from the Messages section. You'll receive notifications when you get a reply.

questions.q: What are saved contacts?
questions.a: When you complete a successful trade or want to remember a user, you can save them as a contact. Your saved contacts appear in the Contacts section for quick access without needing to search for new matches.

questions.q: What is advanced search?
questions.a: Advanced search lets you filter cards by multiple criteria: name, colors, card type, mana value, rarity, set, and more. Access it from the 'Advanced search' link below the search bar or from the Search section in the menu.
